Package com.refinedmods.refinedstorage.api.network.grid.handler

Interface IItemGridHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
ItemGridHandler, PortableItemGridHandler
public interface IItemGridHandler
Defines the behavior of item grids.

  • Method Details

    • onExtract

      void onExtract(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack, int preferredSlot, int flags)
      Called when a player tries to extract an item from the grid through the Inventory
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is attempting the extraction
      stack - the stack we're trying to extract
      preferredSlot - playerInventory slot to prefer when adding or -1
      flags - how we are extracting, see the flags in IItemGridHandler

    • onExtract

      void onExtract(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, UUID id, int preferredSlot, int flags)
      Called when a player tries to extract an item from the grid.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is attempting the extraction
      id - the id of the item we're trying to extract, this id is the id from StackListEntry
      preferredSlot - playerInventory slot to prefer when adding or -1
      flags - how we are extracting, see the flags in IItemGridHandler

    • onInsert

      @Nonnull net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack onInsert(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack stack, boolean single)
      Called when a player tries to insert an item in the grid.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is attempting the insert
      stack - the item we're trying to insert
      single - true if we are only inserting a single item, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the remainder, or an empty stack if there is no remainder

    • onInsertHeldItem

      void onInsertHeldItem(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, boolean single)
      Called when a player is trying to insert an item that it is holding in their hand in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is attempting the insert
      single - true if we are only inserting a single item, false otherwise

    • onCraftingPreviewRequested

      void onCraftingPreviewRequested(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, UUID id, int quantity, boolean noPreview)
      Called when a player requests the crafting preview window to be opened.
      Parameters:
      player - the player
      id - the id of the item we're trying to extract, this id is the id from StackListEntry
      quantity - the amount of that item that we need a preview for
      noPreview - true if the crafting preview window shouldn't be shown, false otherwise

    • onCraftingRequested

      void onCraftingRequested(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, UUID id, int quantity)
      Called when a player requested crafting for an item.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is requesting the crafting
      id - the id of the item we're trying to extract, this id is the id from StackListEntry
      quantity - the amount of the item that has to be crafted

    • onCraftingCancelRequested

      void onCraftingCancelRequested(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, @Nullable UUID id)
      Called when a player wants to cancel a crafting task.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that requested the cancel
      id - the task id, or null to cancel all tasks that are in the network currently

    • onInventoryScroll

      void onInventoryScroll(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, int slot, boolean shift, boolean up)
      Called when a player shift or ctrl scrolls in the player inventory
      Parameters:
      player - player that is scrolling
      slot - slot the mouse is hovering over
      shift - if true shift is pressed, if false ctrl is pressed
      up - whether the player is scrolling up or down

    • onGridScroll

      void onGridScroll(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, @Nullable UUID id, boolean shift, boolean up)
      Called when a player shift or ctrl scrolls in the Grid View
      Parameters:
      player - player that is scrolling
      id - UUID of the GridStack that the mouse is hovering over or null
      shift - if true shift is pressed, if false ctrl is pressed
      up - whether the player is scrolling up or down
